title: Cover, ca. 1870
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: embroidered on patchwork of woven fabric and ribbons
provenance: Mrs. Arthur Stanbury; 1973: acquired by Museum
description: Patchwork cover made from a variety of woven fabrics and ribbons. Diamond shape in the center with a triangle on each side to form a central square surrounded by twelve squares plus an outer border. Each square contains an embroidered naturalistic flower.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cover, ca. 1870.Medium: silk
Technique: embroidered on patchwork of woven fabric and ribbons. Gift of Mrs. Arthur Stanbury. 1973-45-2.
